sentence.text: Drug Label for drug brand Avalide, containing irbesartan and hydrochlorothiazide.

mmtx.phraseText: Drug Label for drug brand Avalide,
Drug Label for drug brand Avalide,

sentence.text: <item>Because of the hydrochlorothiazide component, this product is contraindicated in patients with anuria or hypersensitivity to other sulfonamide-derived drugs.
<item>Do not coadminister aliskiren with AVALIDE in patients with diabetes see Drug Interactions (7).
<item>Do not coadminister aliskiren with AVALIDE in patients with diabetes (4)
Excessive reduction of blood pressure was rarely seen in patients with uncomplicated hypertension treated with irbesartan alone ( 0.1%) or with irbesartan-hydrochlorothiazide (approximately 1%).

Initiation of antihypertensive therapy may cause symptomatic hypotension in patients with intravascular volume- or sodium-depletion, e.g., in patients treated vigorously with diuretics or in patients on dialysis.
Lithium generally should not be given with thiazides.

In double-blind clinical trials of various doses of irbesartan and hydrochlorothiazide, the incidence of hypertensive patients who developed hypokalemia (serum potassium 3.5 mEq/L) was 7.5% versus 6.0% for placebo, the incidence of hyperkalemia (serum potassium 5.7 mEq/L) was 1.0% versus 1.7% for placebo.
On average, the combination of irbesartan and hydrochlorothiazide had no effect on serum potassium.
Higher doses of irbesartan ameliorated the hypokalemic response to hydrochlorothiazide.

Based on experience with the use of other drugs that affect the renin-angiotensin system, concomitant use of potassium-sparing diuretics, potassium supplements, or salt substitutes containing potassium may lead to increases in serum potassium.

entity.text: drugs that affect the renin-angiotensin system

sentence.text: Hydrochlorothiazide may alter glucose tolerance and raise serum levels of cholesterol and triglycerides.
Thiazides may decrease urinary calcium excretion.
Thiazides may cause intermittent and slight elevation of serum calcium in the absence of known disorders of calcium metabolism.
As a consequence of inhibiting the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system, changes in renal function may be anticipated in susceptible individuals see Drug Interactions (7).

In patients whose renal function may depend on the activity of the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system (e.g., patients with severe congestive heart failure), treatment with ACE inhibitors has been associated with oliguria and/or progressive azotemia and (rarely) with acute renal failure and/or death.

mmtx.phraseText: depend on the activity of the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system
depend on the activity of the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system

sentence.text: Sulfonamide or sulfonamide derivative drugs, such as hydrochlorothiazide, can cause an idiosyncratic reaction, resulting in transient myopia and acute angle-closure glaucoma.
<item>NSAIDs and selective COX-2 inhibitors: May lead to increased risk of renal impairment and loss of antihypertensive effect.

mmtx.phraseText: lead to increased risk of renal impairment
lead to increased risk of renal impairment

sentence.text: Monitor renal function periodically.

sentence.text: <item>Dual blockade of the renin-angiotensin system: Increased risk of renal impairment, hypotension, and hyperkalemia.

<item>NSAIDs: Can reduce diuretic, natriuretic, and antihypertensive effects of diuretics and increase risk for renal impairment.

sentence.text: No significant drug-drug interactions have been found in interaction studies with hydrochlorothiazide, digoxin, warfarin, and nifedipine.
Non-Steroidal Anti-Inflammatory Agents Including Selective Cyclooxygenase-2 Inhibitors (COX-2 Inhibitors)

In patients who are elderly, volume-depleted (including those on diuretic therapy), or with compromised renal function, coadministration of NSAIDs, including selective COX-2 inhibitors, with angiotensin II receptor antagonists, including irbesartan, may result in deterioration of renal function, including possible acute renal failure.
Monitor renal function periodically in patients receiving irbesartan and NSAID therapy.
The antihypertensive effect of angiotensin II receptor antagonists, including irbesartan, may be attenuated by NSAIDs including selective COX-2 inhibitors.

mmtx.phraseText: The antihypertensive effect of angiotensin II receptor antagonists,

sentence.text: Dual Blockade of the Renin-Angiotensin System (RAS)

mmtx.phraseText: Dual Blockade of the Renin-Angiotensin System
Dual Blockade of the Renin-Angiotensin System

sentence.text: Dual blockade of the RAS with angiotensin-receptor blockers, ACE inhibitors, or aliskiren is associated with increased risks of hypotension, hyperkalemia, and changes in renal function (including acute renal failure) compared to monotherapy.
Closely monitor blood pressure, renal function, and electrolytes in patients on AVALIDE and other agents that affect the RAS.
Do not coadminister aliskiren with AVALIDE in patients with diabetes.
Avoid use of aliskiren with AVALIDE in patients with renal impairment (GFR 60 mL/min).
Alcohol, Barbiturates, or Narcotics: potentiation of orthostatic hypotension may occur.

ellipsisSentence.text: When administered concurrently the following drugs may interact with thiazide diuretics:

sentence.text: Antidiabetic Drugs (oral agents and insulin): dosage adjustment of the antidiabetic drug may be required.

ellipsisSentence.text: When administered concurrently the following drugs may interact with thiazide diuretics:

middleSentence.text: Alcohol, Barbiturates, or Narcotics: potentiation of orthostatic hypotension may occur.

sentence.text: Cholestyramine and Colestipol Resins: absorption of hydrochlorothiazide is impaired in the presence of anionic exchange resins.
Single doses of either cholestyramine or colestipol resins bind the hydrochlorothiazide and reduce its absorption from the gastrointestinal tract by up to 85% and 43%, respectively.
AVALIDE should be taken at least one hour before or four hours after these medications.

antecedentSentence.Text: Single doses of either cholestyramine or colestipol resins bind the hydrochlorothiazide and reduce its absorption from the gastrointestinal tract by up to 85% and 43%, respectively.
Single doses of either cholestyramine or colestipol resins bind the hydrochlorothiazide and reduce its absorption from the gastrointestinal tract by up to 85% and 43%, respectively.

sentence.text: Corticosteroids, ACTH: intensified electrolyte depletion, particularly hypokalemia.

ellipsisSentence.text: When administered concurrently the following drugs may interact with thiazide diuretics:

middleSentence.text: Alcohol, Barbiturates, or Narcotics: potentiation of orthostatic hypotension may occur.
Antidiabetic Drugs (oral agents and insulin): dosage adjustment of the antidiabetic drug may be required.
Other Antihypertensive Drugs: additive effect or potentiation.
Cholestyramine and Colestipol Resins: absorption of hydrochlorothiazide is impaired in the presence of anionic exchange resins.
Single doses of either cholestyramine or colestipol resins bind the hydrochlorothiazide and reduce its absorption from the gastrointestinal tract by up to 85% and 43%, respectively.
AVALIDE should be taken at least one hour before or four hours after these medications.

ellipsisSentence.text: When administered concurrently the following drugs may interact with thiazide diuretics:

Other Antihypertensive Drugs: additive effect or potentiation.
Cholestyramine and Colestipol Resins: absorption of hydrochlorothiazide is impaired in the presence of anionic exchange resins.
Single doses of either cholestyramine or colestipol resins bind the hydrochlorothiazide and reduce its absorption from the gastrointestinal tract by up to 85% and 43%, respectively.
AVALIDE should be taken at least one hour before or four hours after these medications.

sentence.text: Pressor Amines ( e.g., Norepinephrine): possible decreased response to pressor amines but not sufficient to preclude their use.

ellipsisSentence.text: When administered concurrently the following drugs may interact with thiazide diuretics:

middleSentence.text: Alcohol, Barbiturates, or Narcotics: potentiation of orthostatic hypotension may occur.
Antidiabetic Drugs (oral agents and insulin): dosage adjustment of the antidiabetic drug may be required.
Other Antihypertensive Drugs: additive effect or potentiation.
Cholestyramine and Colestipol Resins: absorption of hydrochlorothiazide is impaired in the presence of anionic exchange resins.
Single doses of either cholestyramine or colestipol resins bind the hydrochlorothiazide and reduce its absorption from the gastrointestinal tract by up to 85% and 43%, respectively.
AVALIDE should be taken at least one hour before or four hours after these medications.
Corticosteroids, ACTH: intensified electrolyte depletion, particularly hypokalemia.

sentence.text: Skeletal Muscle Relaxants, Nondepolarizing ( e.g., Tubocurarine): possible increased responsiveness to the muscle relaxant.

ellipsisSentence.text: When administered concurrently the following drugs may interact with thiazide diuretics:

middleSentence.text: Alcohol, Barbiturates, or Narcotics: potentiation of orthostatic hypotension may occur.
Antidiabetic Drugs (oral agents and insulin): dosage adjustment of the antidiabetic drug may be required.
Other Antihypertensive Drugs: additive effect or potentiation.
Cholestyramine and Colestipol Resins: absorption of hydrochlorothiazide is impaired in the presence of anionic exchange resins.
Single doses of either cholestyramine or colestipol resins bind the hydrochlorothiazide and reduce its absorption from the gastrointestinal tract by up to 85% and 43%, respectively.
AVALIDE should be taken at least one hour before or four hours after these medications.
Corticosteroids, ACTH: intensified electrolyte depletion, particularly hypokalemia.
Pressor Amines ( e.g., Norepinephrine): possible decreased response to pressor amines but not sufficient to preclude their use.

sentence.text: Lithium: should not generally be given with diuretics.
Diuretic agents reduce the renal clearance of lithium and add a high risk of lithium toxicity.

mmtx.phraseText: a high risk of lithium toxicity.

sentence.text: Refer to the package insert for lithium preparations before use of such preparations with AVALIDE.

Non-steroidal Anti-inflammatory Drugs: in some patients, the administration of a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory agent can reduce the diuretic, natriuretic, and antihypertensive effects of loop, potassium-sparing, and thiazide diuretics.

mmtx.phraseText: the administration of a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory agent
the administration of a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory agent

sentence.text: Therefore, when AVALIDE (irbesartan-hydrochlorothiazide) Tablets and non-steroidal anti-inflammatory agents are used concomitantly, the patient should be observed closely to determine if the desired effect of the diuretic is obtained.
Carbamazepine: concomitant use of carbamazepine and hydrochlorothiazide has been associated with the risk of symptomatic hyponatremia.

mmtx.phraseText: associated with the risk of symptomatic hyponatremia.

sentence.text: Electrolytes should be monitored during concomitant use.

ellipsisSentence.text: Carbamazepine: concomitant use of carbamazepine and hydrochlorothiazide has been associated with the risk of symptomatic hyponatremia.
Carbamazepine: concomitant use of carbamazepine and hydrochlorothiazide has been associated with the risk of symptomatic hyponatremia.
